intro: Orthocarpus strictus, commonly known as the rigid orthocarpus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has narrow, upright leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in a dense cluster at the top of the stem. Orthocarpus strictus is known for its resilience to arid conditions and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
